Locations.Name: Arada
Locations.Description: The capital of The Kingdom of Danar. A well fortified city with two fortresses, a keep, several garisons with a small, but permanent serving army, and hundreds of thousands families living in or around it. This is where the King of Danar lives, a long lasting member of the Arada family.

Market.Name: Poorly crafted crossbow
Market.Description: A hand-held bow-like assembly on a long stock with a string lock. A weapon made famous by the Empire of Seracleea due to its en-mass use.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Old and broken seax dagger
Market.Description: A large single-edged blade commongly used by the Dalkyr and the people of the Varga's Stand. The blade is worn horizontally inside a scabbard attached to the belt, with the edge of the blade upwards
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Simple morningstar
Market.Description: A club-like weapons consisting of a shaft with an attached ball adorned with one or more spikes. Each used, to varying degrees, a combination of blunt-force and puncture attack to kill or wound the enemy. The mace is a traditional knightly weapon that developed somewhat independently; as the mace transitioned to being constructed entirely of metal, the morning star retained its characteristic wooden shaft.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Regular spear
Market.Description: A pole weapon consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a pointed head. The most common design for hunting or combat spears since ancient times has incorporated a metal spearhead shaped like a triangle, lozenge, or leaf. Some heads of spears feature barbs or serrated edges.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Old and broken hoggeir
Market.Description: A larger-headed spear with the tip blade measuring between 20 to 60 cm in length and a hollow shaft, mounted on wooden shafts typically made from ash wood. Often used by the Dalkyr and the Midheim peoples respectively with slight differences, since swords were more expensive to make and only wealthy warriors could afford them.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Improvised poleaxe
Market.Description: A heavy wooden haft some 1.2 â€“ 2.0 m long, mounted with a steel axe head, and a spike, hammer, or fluke on the reverse. In addition, there is a spike projecting from the end of the haft, often square in cross section. The poleaxe design arose from the need to breach the plate armour of men at arms
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Newly forged torrak
Market.Description: A type of single-handed axe used by the many peoples and nations of the forests and mountains of Endar, as well as those that live in the rainforests of the Twin Vines due to its inexpensive cost to produce and maintain. It traditionally resembles a hatchet with a straight shaft, and are general-purpose tools, often employed as a hand-to-hand weapon.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Dead weight autharil
Market.Description: A leaf-shaped elven greatsword or heavy two-handed, single-edged sword.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Low quality bardiche
Market.Description: A type of polearm having neither a hook at the back nor a spear point at the top, but a long prominent blade attached on one side. The blade varies greatly in shape, but is most often a long, cleaver-type blade, with a sharp point at the top.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Splintered flail
Market.Description: A short weapon consisting of a wooden haft connected by a chain, rope, or leather to one or more striking ends. Despite being very common in the East, around the Three Seas continent, most military commanders of the western armies doubt the utility of such a weapon in actual practice, due to the hazard the weapon poses to its wielder.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poor pavise
Market.Description: A very large oblong shield, often large enough to cover the entire body. The pavise is characterized by its prominent central ridge with a spike attached to the bottom.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Ordinary euvston
Market.Description: A type of spear composed of a very long wood staff and two pointed iron spear heads. The spear shaft measures 3 m and it is almost always made of cornel wood. The middle of the spear is thinner than the outer edges, giving the spear the impression of a concave shape. This type of spear is widely used by the Endari people, and made its way South into Calvinia where it has become the standard for their foot soldiers.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Dead weight seax dagger
Market.Description: A large single-edged blade commongly used by the Dalkyr and the people of the Varga's Stand. The blade is worn horizontally inside a scabbard attached to the belt, with the edge of the blade upwards
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Old and broken round shield
Market.Description: A shield used by infantry troops. More specifically, this is a concave shield fitted with enarmes on the inside, one adjustable by a buckle, to be attached to the forearm, and the other fixed as a grip for the left hand. Somewhere between 45 to 55 cm, this shield is made from two very thin layers of flat wooden boards, with the grain of each layer at right angles to the other. They are fixed together with small wooden pegs, forming plywood. The front is covered with a tough cowhide, which is often decorated with embossed stylish patterns. This is fixed to the wood with many brass, or in some cases, silver, nails, as occasionally brass plates are also fixed to the face for strength and decoration. Round shields generally have center bosses of brass.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poorly crafted hoggeir
Market.Description: A larger-headed spear with the tip blade measuring between 20 to 60 cm in length and a hollow shaft, mounted on wooden shafts typically made from ash wood. Often used by the Dalkyr and the Midheim peoples respectively with slight differences, since swords were more expensive to make and only wealthy warriors could afford them.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Low quality longsword
Market.Description: A longsword (also spelled as long sword or long-sword) is a type of Danarian sword characterized as having a cruciform hilt with a grip for primarily two-handed use (around 16 to 28 cm), a straight double-edged blade of around 85 to 110 cm, and weighing approximately 1 to 1.5 kg. This well balanced sword has a multitude of roles in combat, as the martial prowess of knights from human kingdoms has proven many times.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Unfinished spear
Market.Description: A pole weapon consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a pointed head. The most common design for hunting or combat spears since ancient times has incorporated a metal spearhead shaped like a triangle, lozenge, or leaf. Some heads of spears feature barbs or serrated edges.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Simple zagariz
Market.Description: A long-shafted weapon with a metal head, with an either sharp (axe-like) or blunt (hammer-like) edge on one side and a sharp (straight or curving) 'ice-pick'-like point on the other. A weapon used mostly by the steppe people of the Far Endar.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Stolen-improvised poleaxe
Market.Description: A heavy wooden haft some 1.2 â€“ 2.0 m long, mounted with a steel axe head, and a spike, hammer, or fluke on the reverse. In addition, there is a spike projecting from the end of the haft, often square in cross section. The poleaxe design arose from the need to breach the plate armour of men at arms
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Info.Name: Elf_414
Info.Fame: This person is quite well known around Arada.

Mainhand.Name: Somewhat useful for desired purpose warhammer
Mainhand.Description: A war hammer consists of a handle and a head. These weapons, especially when mounted on a pole, could in some cases transmit their impact through helms and cause concussions. Most warhammers often have a spike on one side of the head, making them more versatile weapons. The spike end could be used for grappling the target's armour, reins, or shield, If against mounted opponents, the weapon could also be directed at the legs of a horse, toppling the armoured foe to the ground where they could be more easily attacked.
Mainhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Offhand.Name: Conventional esthenn
Offhand.Description: A short, curved dagger with a hollow blade, typically of elven origin. These daggers are sometimes made of crystal, although this is a tradition of Three Seas elven origin.
Offhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Ranged.Name: Ordinary longbow
Ranged.Description: A type of tall bow that makes a fairly long draw possible. A longbow is not significantly recurved. Its limbs are relatively narrow and are circular or D-shaped in cross section. Generally made from yew and with a length of 1.8 m, these weapons are famous because they can be made from a single piece of wood, it can be crafted relatively easily and quickly. Estimates for the draw weight of these bows are considerable.
Ranged.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Info.Name: Dwarf_421
Info.Fame: This person is quite well known around Arada.

Head.Name: Old and broken sallet
Head.Description: A round-skulled helm with a distinctive rear part curved into a flange to protect the neck. It has a short tail and a jawbone type visor with a brow reinforcing. Stylistically, it is termed a high crowned helm. A plume holder was added to the helm at some time after its manufacture. These types of helms are considered both rare and important, therefore only high-born members of the society wear them in combat.
Head.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Mainhand.Name: Common hoggeir
Mainhand.Description: A larger-headed spear with the tip blade measuring between 20 to 60 cm in length and a hollow shaft, mounted on wooden shafts typically made from ash wood. Often used by the Dalkyr and the Midheim peoples respectively with slight differences, since swords were more expensive to make and only wealthy warriors could afford them.
Mainhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Ranged.Name: Blacksmith's zirahkeel
Ranged.Description: A dwarven arbalest with an iron lever which makes the loading of the crossbow much easier, if you have the strength to push it.
Ranged.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Info.Name: Human_421
Info.Fame: This person is quite well known around Arada.

Head.Name: Ordinary bascinet
Head.Description: An open-faced combat helm. It evolved from a type of iron or steel skullcap, but had a more pointed apex to the skull, and it extended downwards at the rear and sides to afford protection for the neck. A mail curtain (aventail or camail) is usually attached to the lower edge of the helm to protect the neck and shoulders.
Head.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Body.Name: Splintered brigandine
Body.Description: A garment typically made of heavy cloth, canvas, or leather, lined internally with small oblong plates riveted to the fabric, sometimes with a second layer of fabric on the inside. Unlike armour for the torso made from large plates, the brigandine is flexible, with a degree of movement between each of the overlapping plates. Many brigandines appear to have larger, somewhat L-shaped plates over the central chest area. The rivets attaching the plates to the fabric are often decorated, being gilt, or of latten, and sometimes embossed with a design. The rivets are also often grouped to produce a repeating decorative pattern.
Body.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Mainhand.Name: Simple warhammer
Mainhand.Description: A war hammer consists of a handle and a head. These weapons, especially when mounted on a pole, could in some cases transmit their impact through helms and cause concussions. Most warhammers often have a spike on one side of the head, making them more versatile weapons. The spike end could be used for grappling the target's armour, reins, or shield, If against mounted opponents, the weapon could also be directed at the legs of a horse, toppling the armoured foe to the ground where they could be more easily attacked.
Mainhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Offhand.Name: Stolen-improvised quillon dagger
Offhand.Description: A brown leather over a wood grip, steel guard and pommel and double sided steel blade. The dagger is often employed in the role of a secondary defense weapon in close combat.
Offhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Ranged.Name: Stolen-improvised arbalest
Ranged.Description: A large crossbow with a steel prod (the bow portion of the weapon). This late variation is more common among the people of Danar.
Ranged.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Heraldry.Name: Dead weight jewelry
Heraldry.Description: A small ornament or item of jewellery that is of symbolic value.
Heraldry.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Heraldry.Name: Stolen-improvised jewelry
Heraldry.Description: A small ornament or item of jewellery that is of symbolic value.
Heraldry.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Locations.Name: Belfordshire
Locations.Description: A modest settlement, mostly inhabited by soldiers safeguarding the southern border of Danar with the forests of Pel'Ravan mountains, merchants stopping by and their mercenaries. Expect mud, sweat, horses and the sharpening of steel to be omnious here.

Market.Name: Stolen-improvised plate armour
Market.Description: A full suit of plate armour consisting of a gorget (or bevor), spaulders, pauldrons with gardbraces to cover the armpits or besagews (also known as rondels), rerebraces, couters, vambraces, gauntlets, a cuirass (breastplate and backplate) with a fauld, tassets and a culet, a mail skirt, cuisses, poleyns, greaves, and sabatons. This is the most complete type of armour any soldier can field at any time.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Incomplete katabuto
Market.Description: Is a traditional helm worn by the people of the Stormwatch Mts. It is made by combining dozens of thin iron plates, has a conical shape and is largely covered in decorations.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Improvised spear
Market.Description: A pole weapon consisting of a shaft, usually of wood, with a pointed head. The most common design for hunting or combat spears since ancient times has incorporated a metal spearhead shaped like a triangle, lozenge, or leaf. Some heads of spears feature barbs or serrated edges.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Ordinary sallet
Market.Description: A round-skulled helm with a distinctive rear part curved into a flange to protect the neck. It has a short tail and a jawbone type visor with a brow reinforcing. Stylistically, it is termed a high crowned helm. A plume holder was added to the helm at some time after its manufacture. These types of helms are considered both rare and important, therefore only high-born members of the society wear them in combat.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Regular commodities
Market.Description: Commodities are found in the majority of goods that end up in the hands of merchants, including spice, tea, meats, liquor, and clothing. Other most common commodities include copper, oils, wheat, coffee beans, and semi-precious stones.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Splintered quillon dagger
Market.Description: A brown leather over a wood grip, steel guard and pommel and double sided steel blade. The dagger is often employed in the role of a secondary defense weapon in close combat.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poor scale mail
Market.Description: A form of armour consisting of many individual small armour scales (plates) of various shapes attached to each other and to a backing of cloth or leather in overlapping rows resembling the scales of a fish/reptile or roofing tiles. The scales are usually assembled and strapped by lacing or rivets. It is one of the most common armour type of the professional Calvinian and Endari armies of the eastern Av'el'Raan.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Unfinished sling
Market.Description: The sling is much more than merely an extension of the arm. By its double-pendulum kinetics, the sling enables stones (or spears) to be thrown much further than they could be by hand alone. The sling is inexpensive and easy to build. A sling bullet lobbed in a high trajectory can achieve ranges in excess of 400 m.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Raw quithil
Market.Description: A lightweight medium-sized bow of elven origin which fits perfectly and inexplicably well in the palm of even a lesser experienced archer, able to deliver powerful and precise shots, as long as arrows are in no short supply.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poorly crafted nikoto
Market.Description: A sword characterized by a curved, single-edged blade with a circular or squared guard and long grip to accommodate two hands. Particularly worn with the edge facing upward. Typical features are a three-dimensional cross-sectional shape of an elongated pentagonal to hexagonal blade, a style in which the blade is integrated and fixed to the hilt with a pin, and a gentle curve. This style of blade has a high cutting ability.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poorly crafted ornaments
Market.Description: Items often worn to embellish, enhance, or distinguish the wearer, and to define cultural, social, or religious status within a specific community.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Regular zagariz
Market.Description: A long-shafted weapon with a metal head, with an either sharp (axe-like) or blunt (hammer-like) edge on one side and a sharp (straight or curving) 'ice-pick'-like point on the other. A weapon used mostly by the steppe people of the Far Endar.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Unfinished commodities
Market.Description: Commodities are found in the majority of goods that end up in the hands of merchants, including spice, tea, meats, liquor, and clothing. Other most common commodities include copper, oils, wheat, coffee beans, and semi-precious stones.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Normal zagariz
Market.Description: A long-shafted weapon with a metal head, with an either sharp (axe-like) or blunt (hammer-like) edge on one side and a sharp (straight or curving) 'ice-pick'-like point on the other. A weapon used mostly by the steppe people of the Far Endar.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Splintered boar spear
Market.Description: A relatively short and heavy spear which has two lugs or wings on the spearsocket behind the blade, these act as a barrier to prevent the spear from penetrating too deeply into the target where it might get stuck or break, and to stop an injured and furious enemy from working its way up the shaft of the spear to attack.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Dead weight jewelry
Market.Description: A small ornament or item of jewellery that is of symbolic value.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Normal quithil
Market.Description: A lightweight medium-sized bow of elven origin which fits perfectly and inexplicably well in the palm of even a lesser experienced archer, able to deliver powerful and precise shots, as long as arrows are in no short supply.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Unfinished longsword
Market.Description: A longsword (also spelled as long sword or long-sword) is a type of Danarian sword characterized as having a cruciform hilt with a grip for primarily two-handed use (around 16 to 28 cm), a straight double-edged blade of around 85 to 110 cm, and weighing approximately 1 to 1.5 kg. This well balanced sword has a multitude of roles in combat, as the martial prowess of knights from human kingdoms has proven many times.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Improvised commodities
Market.Description: Commodities are found in the majority of goods that end up in the hands of merchants, including spice, tea, meats, liquor, and clothing. Other most common commodities include copper, oils, wheat, coffee beans, and semi-precious stones.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Somewhat useful for desired purpose bardiche
Market.Description: A type of polearm having neither a hook at the back nor a spear point at the top, but a long prominent blade attached on one side. The blade varies greatly in shape, but is most often a long, cleaver-type blade, with a sharp point at the top.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Incomplete ornaments
Market.Description: Items often worn to embellish, enhance, or distinguish the wearer, and to define cultural, social, or religious status within a specific community.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Ordinary long flail
Market.Description: A weapon consisting of a striking head attached to a long handle by a flexible rope, strap, or chain. The chief tactical virtue of the flail was its capacity to strike around a defender's shield or parry. Its chief liability was a lack of precision and the difficulty of using it in close combat, or closely-ranked formations. It is primarily considered a peasant's weapon, and while not common, they have been deployed in combat.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Conventional normaund shield
Market.Description: A large, almond-shaped shield rounded at the top and curving down to a point or rounded point at the bottom. This shield is developed for mounted cavalry, and its dimensions correlate to the approximate space between a horse's neck and its rider's thigh. To compensate for their awkward nature, these shields are equipped with enarmes, which grip the shield tightly to the arm and facilitate keeping it in place even when a knight relaxes their arm; this was a significant departure from most earlier circular shields, which possessed only a single handle. Some examples are apparently also fitted with an additional guige strap that allowed the shield to be slung over one shoulder when not in use.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Conventional korintos helm
Market.Description: A helm that covers the entire head and neck, with slits for the eyes and mouth. A large curved projection protected the nape of the neck. This helm is massively used by the soldiers of Three Seas dynasties.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Improvised azaga
Market.Description: A pole weapon used for throwing, usually a light spear or javelin made up of a wooden handle and an iron tip. This weapon is typically used with one hand while the off hand holds a shield for protection.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Stolen-improvised sling
Market.Description: The sling is much more than merely an extension of the arm. By its double-pendulum kinetics, the sling enables stones (or spears) to be thrown much further than they could be by hand alone. The sling is inexpensive and easy to build. A sling bullet lobbed in a high trajectory can achieve ranges in excess of 400 m.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Increased quality ring-sword
Market.Description: A blade with normally smooth or a very shallow fuller, often having multiple bands of pattern-welding within the central portion. Having its origins with the Dalkyr and the northern kindoms, although some can be found among the peoples of the Stormwatch Mountains.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poor na-ga
Market.Description: A legendary elven one-handed twin bladed axe used by the Daifathrim elves of Pel'Ravan. It features two crescent blades facing off from each other, able to deliver a striking blow to an lightly armoured opponent or used in grapling.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Ordinary esthenn
Market.Description: A short, curved dagger with a hollow blade, typically of elven origin. These daggers are sometimes made of crystal, although this is a tradition of Three Seas elven origin.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Improvised boar spear
Market.Description: A relatively short and heavy spear which has two lugs or wings on the spearsocket behind the blade, these act as a barrier to prevent the spear from penetrating too deeply into the target where it might get stuck or break, and to stop an injured and furious enemy from working its way up the shaft of the spear to attack.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Dead weight atl
Market.Description: A tool that uses leverage to achieve greater velocity in dart or javelin-throwing, and includes a bearing surface which allows the user to store energy during the throw. It consists of a shaft with a cup or a spur at the end that supports and propels the butt of the dart. It's usually about as long as the user's arm or forearm, as those used by the people of the Twin Vines forests.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Improvised azaga
Market.Description: A pole weapon used for throwing, usually a light spear or javelin made up of a wooden handle and an iron tip. This weapon is typically used with one hand while the off hand holds a shield for protection.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Regular korintos helm
Market.Description: A helm that covers the entire head and neck, with slits for the eyes and mouth. A large curved projection protected the nape of the neck. This helm is massively used by the soldiers of Three Seas dynasties.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Market.Name: Poorly crafted sling
Market.Description: The sling is much more than merely an extension of the arm. By its double-pendulum kinetics, the sling enables stones (or spears) to be thrown much further than they could be by hand alone. The sling is inexpensive and easy to build. A sling bullet lobbed in a high trajectory can achieve ranges in excess of 400 m.
Market.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Info.Name: Elf_152
Info.Fame: This person is quite well known around Belfordshire.

Head.Name: Newly forged nasal helm
Head.Description: A helm characterised by the possession of a nose-guard, or nasal, composed of a single strip of metal that extended down from the skull or browband over the nose to provide facial protection.
Head.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Body.Name: Unfinished gambeson
Body.Description: A padded defensive jacket, worn as armour separately, or combined with mail or plate armour. Gambesons are produced with a sewing technique called quilting. They are usually constructed of linen or wool; the stuffing varied, and could be for example scrap cloth or horse hair. For common soldiers who could not afford mail or plate armour, the gambeson, combined with a helm as the only additional protection, remains a common sight on western battlefields, throughout the entire Dragonmaw continent.
Body.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Mainhand.Name: Dead weight boar spear
Mainhand.Description: A relatively short and heavy spear which has two lugs or wings on the spearsocket behind the blade, these act as a barrier to prevent the spear from penetrating too deeply into the target where it might get stuck or break, and to stop an injured and furious enemy from working its way up the shaft of the spear to attack.
Mainhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Ranged.Name: Simple quithil
Ranged.Description: A lightweight medium-sized bow of elven origin which fits perfectly and inexplicably well in the palm of even a lesser experienced archer, able to deliver powerful and precise shots, as long as arrows are in no short supply.
Ranged.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Info.Name: Elf_152
Info.Fame: This person is quite well known around Belfordshire.

Body.Name: Improvised coat of plates
Body.Description: A form of segmented torso armour consisting of overlapping metal plates riveted inside a cloth or leather garment. Unlike scale armour which has plates on the outside, a coat of plates has the plates on the inside of the foundation garment. It is generally distinguished from its western, Danarian brigandine, counterpart by having larger plates, though there may be no distinction in some examples.
Body.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Mainhand.Name: Conventional flanged mace
Mainhand.Description: A solid metal mace able to inflict damage on well armoured knights, as the force of a blow from a mace is great enough to cause damage without penetrating the armour. Being simple to make, cheap, and straightforward in application, they are quite common weapons. The flanged mace is a favorite weapon among the Calvinian elite, as it became a symbol of power of their military leaders.
Mainhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Offhand.Name: Incomplete keris
Offhand.Description: An asymmetrical dagger with distinctive blade-patterning achieved through alternating laminations of iron and nickelous iron, famous for its distinctive wavy blade.
Offhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Ranged.Name: Splintered short bow
Ranged.Description: A traditional composite bow made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together, a form of laminated bow. The horn is on the belly, facing the archer, and sinew on the outer side of a wooden core. When the bow is drawn, the sinew (stretched on the outside) and horn (compressed on the inside) store more energy than wood for the same length of bow. More powerful than the longbow, they can also retain a much higher degree of accuracy and a faster reload rate. Mostly employed by mounted archers and steppe people, they have been used extensively to stop Kardah or Calvinian expansions in the West Endari steppes.
Ranged.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Info.Name: Elf_152
Info.Fame: This person is quite well known around Belfordshire.

Head.Name: Unfinished norse helm
Head.Description: The construction of this helm is complex. It consists of four parts: an iron skull cap with brass edging and decorations, two iron cheek guards with brass edging, and camail protecting the neck. The cap of the helm has eight iron components. A brow band encircles the head; a nose-to-nape band extends from back to front, where it narrows and continues downwards as the nasal; two lateral bands each connect the side of the brow band to the top of the nose-to-nape band; and four subtriangular infill plates sit underneath the resulting holes. The eight pieces are riveted together. A usual sight on the battlefield of the northern Dragonmaw continent.
Head.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Body.Name: Common scale mail
Body.Description: A form of armour consisting of many individual small armour scales (plates) of various shapes attached to each other and to a backing of cloth or leather in overlapping rows resembling the scales of a fish/reptile or roofing tiles. The scales are usually assembled and strapped by lacing or rivets. It is one of the most common armour type of the professional Calvinian and Endari armies of the eastern Av'el'Raan.
Body.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Shield.Name: Incomplete scutum
Shield.Description: The scutum is a 10 kg large rectangle curved shield made from three sheets of wood glued together and covered with canvas and leather, usually with a spindle shaped boss along the vertical length of the shield. The scutum is light enough to be held in one hand and its large height and width cover the entire soldier, making him very unlikely to be hit by missile fire and in hand-to-hand combat.
Shield.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Mainhand.Name: Ordinary flail
Mainhand.Description: A short weapon consisting of a wooden haft connected by a chain, rope, or leather to one or more striking ends. Despite being very common in the East, around the Three Seas continent, most military commanders of the western armies doubt the utility of such a weapon in actual practice, due to the hazard the weapon poses to its wielder.
Mainhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Offhand.Name: Battered quillon dagger
Offhand.Description: A brown leather over a wood grip, steel guard and pommel and double sided steel blade. The dagger is often employed in the role of a secondary defense weapon in close combat.
Offhand.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.

Ranged.Name: Regular quithil
Ranged.Description: A lightweight medium-sized bow of elven origin which fits perfectly and inexplicably well in the palm of even a lesser experienced archer, able to deliver powerful and precise shots, as long as arrows are in no short supply.
Ranged.Lore: Not much can be said about this item.
